tickets.summary: Feature Request: "User [username] has logged into node #"
tickets.description:
Feature Request: LOW priority.
Just something I think would be nice to have.

Add option to announce to user(s) that another user has logged in on other node.

I think there used to be a MOD for this in the 4.2x days.

posts.text: It might also be nice for this to be a flag in your user preferences so you can turn it off if you want.  Also, it would be a good option in wwiv.ini to allow a user the ability to enable/disable it.
posts.author: rockdw
posts.subject: #6 Feature Request: "User [username] has logged into node #"

tickets.description: I would really like to see being able to use something other than telnet to more securely connect

posts.text:
Would telnet-ssl do?
I have a working telnet-ssl setup on aliens now.
I'm wondering how to implement a secure ssh setup with the BBS.
posts.author: xenos
posts.subject: #7 Support for ssh connectivity

posts.text: Can you setup a tunnel now with ssh and tunnel to your local port (i.e. not bind 23 externally)?
posts.author: rushfan
posts.subject: #7 Support for ssh connectivity

posts.text: Sure, but there are a number of issues with doing it that way.  Not the least of which is relying on the end user to manage creating an ssh tunnel.  The ideal situation would be that the BBS could handle ssh on its own and not put the burden on the user.
posts.author: rockdw
posts.subject: #7 Support for ssh connectivity

tickets.summary: SysOp Message to specific users as they log-in
tickets.description:
It would be nice to have the ability to have a bulletin or message that selected users are forced to read at login with option to clear after read once or display every time, or only a select number of times.
Not necessarily something that all users would see.

posts.text:
like a short message or like a forced bulletin?  There's already this in wwiv.ini

FORCE_SCAN = [Y|N]
FORCE_SCAN_SUBNUM = [:digit:]

To force users to read a sub (for this type of message).

Is that sufficient?


You mean on a per-user basis? 

Would a SSM (short 1 line message) be enough?  I'm trying to understand the usecase.

Thanks
posts.author: rushfan
posts.subject: #8 SysOp Message to specific users as they log-in

posts.text:
I like that feature but I was thinking of something more user specific or to a group of users. 
An SSM would work or even a bulletin that a specific user or users with a specific user level would see on every login. 

Maybe a future MOD?
posts.author: bsbbsoutlaw
posts.subject: #8 SysOp Message to specific users as they log-in

posts.text:
QuickBBS used to have this. a file named SL##### (where ###### was your security level) would be displayed during login.  

Would this be sufficient?

What if we added
SL#
DSL#
AR#
DAR#

Would that be sufficient?
posts.author: rushfan
posts.subject: #8 SysOp Message to specific users as they log-in

posts.text:
Yes!!
That would be perfect!


Sent from my Verizon Wireless 4G LTE Smartphone


-------- Original message --------
From: Rushfan
Date:08/15/2014 5:28 PM (GMT-08:00)
To: "[wwiv:feature-requests]" <8@feature-requests.wwiv.p.re.sf.net>
Subject: [wwiv:feature-requests] #8 SysOp Message to specific users as they log-in

QuickBBS used to have this. a file named SL##### (where ###### was your security level) would be displayed during login.

Would this be sufficient?

What if we added
SL#
DSL#
AR#
DAR#

Would that be sufficient?

posts.text:

WWIV v5.00 (Development) Initialization/Configuration Program.
Copyright (c) 1998-2014, WWIV Software Services
                                                  [[ DELETED USER ]]
Name/Handle      : TEST USER 3 #215
